title: How to Apply a Mud Mask

steps.title: Scoop out some beauty mud.
steps.content: Scoop out some beauty mud. Use your middle and ring fingers to scoop out some of the beauty mud. Start with a small amount, about the size of a dime. If you'd like to apply a thick layer of beauty mud, you can scoop out a larger amount. [1] X Research source Remember, it's easier to add beauty mud to your face than remove excess.

steps.title: Spread the beauty mud.
steps.content: Spread the beauty mud. Place the beauty mud on the apples of your cheeks and gently spread it around your cheeks, forehead, temples, chin, and nose. You can apply a thin layer if you want a quick mud mask that's easy to remove. [2] X Research source If you apply a thick opaque layer of beauty mud, you'll be able to keep it on your skin longer since it won't dry out your skin's face as quickly.

steps.title: Avoid applying the mask to your eye area.
steps.content: Avoid applying the mask to your eye area. While you can cover your entire face with the mask, you should avoid using the beauty mud around your eye. The skin around your eye is delicate and if you apply mud to the area, you risk getting it in your eye, especially when removing the mask. [3] X Research source Stand in front of a mirror when you apply the mask so you can easily avoid the eyes. You should make sure to cover any blemishes or acne-prone areas of your skin. Just be gentle when you apply the beauty mud so you don't irritate the skin further.

steps.title: Wait for 15 minutes.
steps.content: Wait for 15 minutes. Once you've applied the mud mask, leave it on for 15 minutes or until the mud starts drying out. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wash off the mud mask.
steps.content: Wash off the mud mask. Take a clean cotton cloth and soak it in lukewarm water. Wring it out completely and gently rub it against the mud mask. Keep rinsing and wringing out the cloth in between rubbing the mask off. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source [6] X Research source Be gentle when you remove the mask. Rubbing your skin roughly can damage your delicate skin. If you're having trouble removing the mask, soak your cloth in hot water and place it over your face for about 30 seconds. Then, use the cloth to wipe the mask off.

steps.title: Rinse your face.
steps.content: Rinse your face. After most of the mud mask has been cleaned off, splash your face with lukewarm water. This will help remove any remaining mud mask. [7] X Research source Avoid using hot or cold water. These can shock your skin or overly dry it.

steps.title: Pat your skin dry.
steps.content: Pat your skin dry. Take a soft clean cloth and carefully pat your face dry. Avoid rubbing your skin since this could damage your sensitive skin. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select a mud mask.
steps.content: Select a mud mask. You have lots of options when choosing a mud mask. Read label descriptions to find a mud mask that will work with your skin type. Depending on your skin type, look for a mask that has specific qualities. For: [9] X Research source [10] X Research source Dry skin: look for a hydrating product with moisturizing oils Blemish-prone skin: choose a clay mask that can reduce oil and clear up acne Sensitive skin: pick a mask that has minerals to reduce inflammation Combination skin: consider applying two different masks to different parts of your face based on your skin type

steps.title: Tie your hair back.
steps.content: Tie your hair back. If you have longer hair, you should tie your hair back into a ponytail. This will keep your hair from falling in front of your face or getting stuck in the beauty mud while you apply the mask. [11] X Research source If your hair does get mud mask on it, simply wet the strand with a wet cloth and rub the beauty mud out.

steps.title: Clean or steam your skin.
steps.content: Clean or steam your skin. It's a good idea to remove excess oil and buildup from your skin before you apply a mud mask. It will also make the mud mask adhere to your skin easier. Wash and dry your skin or do a steam facial. [12] X Research source Steam is a great way to open up your pores. It will also let the mud mask penetrate deeper into your skin.

steps.title: Apply a facial oil or moisturizer.
steps.content: Apply a facial oil or moisturizer. Put a few drops of the oil in the palm of your hand and rub your hands together. Gently pat your hands over your face so that the oil is evenly applied to your skin. You can do this before applying the beauty mud since it can dry out your skin. [13] X Research source Consider using a facial oil or moisturizer after removing the mud mask to further hydrate your skin.

steps.title: Limit your mud masks.
steps.content: Limit your mud masks. When used correctly, mud masks can improve your skin tone. But, since mud masks can dry out your skin, you shouldn't apply them more than once a week. If you have oily skin, you might be able to apply a mud mask up to twice a week to control oil production. [14] X Research source [15] X Research source If you have zits or blemishes, you can apply a mud mask just to the trouble spots. Do this whenever you have a breakout.
